team.name: Sarah Johnson
team.bio: Sarah loves creating magical stories for kids. She has been writing children's stories for over 10 years! With a degree in Children's Literature, Sarah ensures every story sparks imagination and teaches valuable lessons.
team.funFact: Sarah's favorite planet is Saturn because of its beautiful rings!

team.name: Mike Chen
team.bio: Mike brings stories to life with beautiful illustrations. He loves drawing space adventures and friendly aliens! With 15 years of experience in digital art and animation, Mike creates vibrant, kid-friendly artwork that makes every page come alive.
team.funFact: Mike can draw a rocket in under 30 seconds!

team.name: Emma Williams
team.bio: Emma creates fun learning activities and quizzes. She makes sure learning is always fun and engaging! With a Master's in Early Childhood Education, Emma designs curriculum-aligned content that helps kids learn while having fun.
team.funFact: Emma has visited 20+ planetariums around the world!

team.name: David Martinez
team.bio: David makes sure our website works perfectly and looks amazing. He loves coding and creating interactive experiences! A full-stack developer with 12 years of experience, David builds seamless user experiences and ensures our site is fast, safe, and fun for kids.
team.funFact: David built his first website when he was 10 years old!

team.name: Lisa Park
team.bio: Lisa creates amazing craft tutorials and DIY projects. She loves helping kids express their creativity through hands-on activities! With a background in art therapy, Lisa designs crafts that are both fun and therapeutic. She's created over 100 craft tutorials.
team.funFact: Lisa can make origami animals with her eyes closed!

team.name: James Thompson
team.bio: James writes fascinating science articles and facts that make complex topics easy to understand for kids. With a PhD in Astrophysics, James has a talent for explaining space and science in fun, kid-friendly ways. He loves sharing his passion for space.
team.funFact: James has a telescope named after him at a local observatory!
